column4: does anybody here have experience with ubuntu on japanese laptops, i am trying to get dapper to work on a dynabook, japanese keyboard, can someone help? will scim do?
I guess you need scim and scim-tables-ja
not as far as I know :(
are you using japanese on ubuntu?
no, but I've messed around with scim before when debugging that sort of thing.
are you still having problems?  did you install those packages I mentioned?
i am updating righ now. i`ll try once i get this done

my girlfriend had issues with windows so i installed ubuntu on her laptop, i just hope that the input method works out fine, coz she doesn`t do much except for browsing and emailing, so i am sure she`ll like it
well, to be honest, I've only ever used cjk support in kubuntu - I'm not sure how different it is under gnome.
should be the same in ubuntu then
you know the difference between scim anthy prime and canna?
only what "apt-cache show scim-anthy scim-prime scim-canna" tells me
i think that`s it, i am trying, thanks
